root.tree-val: Austronesian Languages of Taiwan and Orchid Island, subtree of Austronesian: Tsuchida 2009
root.pub-comments: "Tentative Sub-grouping of the Austronesian Languages in Taiwan and Orchid Island" (Tsuchida 2009: 73)
root.publications: Tsuchida, Shigeru. 2009. Japanese Contribution to the Linguistic Studies of the Formosan Indigenous Languages. In David Blundell & David Blundell (eds.), Austronesian Taiwan: Linguistics, History, Ethnology, Prehistory, Revised Edition edn., 71-91. Berkeley, CA: Phoebe A. Hearst Museum of Anthropology.

child.tree-val: Austronesian Languages of Taiwan and Orchid Island, subtree of Austronesian: Tsuchida 2009
child.pub-comments: 6,700 speakers in 1995, and 6,500 speakers in 2008, according to The Council of Indigenous Peoples, Executive Yuan (www.apc.gov.tw). Competent indigenous language speakers are far less than the ethnic populations given.

child.tree-val: Austronesian Languages of Taiwan and Orchid Island, subtree of Austronesian: Tsuchida 2009
child.pub-comments: Atayal and Seediq combined have 81,000 speakers, according to The Council of Indigenous Peoples, Executive Yuan (www.apc.gov.tw) in 2008. Competent indigenous language speakers are far less than the ethnic populations given.
